== New Wave ==

It is time to give a modern look to our favorite distribution! The new theme should make a more clever use of orange than previously (not over-use it), should be mainly color-neutral, and everyting except taskbars and windows borders should be white or light gray for readability reasons and to keep everything less heavy than many existing dark themes. (...)
In this page we will follow only the significant changes to the theme (such as major version and best development ideas and contributions)

=== Contribution ===

If you want to help with the development of the theme you can '''<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-new-wave|join the New Wave team]]</nowiki>''' @ Launch Pad or <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/anton/|report bugs here]]</nowiki>. Currently there is need for:

* Testers
* Firefox skinner to polish the Firefox theme
* Icon creators/artists for the Elementary Ubuntu or Breath iconset
